content.description: This route is essentially 5.9 A0 or .11+/12-.  If you clip the first bolt and french-free through the starting bulge, you'll be rewarded with a nice, moderate slab.  Or try to climb through the awkward and fairly difficult start, and probably be disappointed by how easy the rest of the route is.  Your choice.
content.protection: 4-5 bolts and a green alien/blue TCU/.3 Camalot to anchors.  Bolts are new as of 2009.
content.location: Farthest right route at Space Wall, on the slab.

content.description: Long, sustained technical face route. 11b/c to the lower set of chains, 12b/c to the higher set above the lip.
content.location: First route right of Neanderthal Dudes (11d), start from the base rather than on top of the slab.

content.description: 3rd climb from left on wall (2nd climb right of Kwijwabo). Great face climbing on good flakes and edges.  Crux is technical with high pump factor cause it comes at the end of the route.  IMHO, one of the best sport climbs at Donnor.  In fact, the whole wall is excellent.
content.protection: 9 bolts, well protected.  Crux between last bolt and anchor (chains).  Can easily be top roped by topping out on Kwijwabo and moving rope.

content.description:
Fun climb on the black rock to the right of Made in Japan.

Take some draws and enjoy this route.  I forget where the crux was.  I have also seen this route go on natural pro, but it seemed like dicey crap in some of the flakes.
content.location:
50' right of Made in Japan, off some ledge systems.  Fun climbing and a good warmup for the harder routes on Space Wall.

Lower/rap.

content.description:
Made in Japan is a long vertical climb that begins on the blunt arete on the main face of Space Wall.  It first uses a finger crack before finding its way past a series of flakes to some technical face moves before finally turning the arete and finishing on some easier slabby granite.

Some of the large flakes are a little loose and will probably fall off one day.  I recommend getting on the route before that happens because Made in Japan isn't worth missing.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  Recommend a sling for 3rd bolt.

content.description:
Kwijiwabo is one of three climbs that starts off a ledge above left side of the base of Space Wall.  Of the three climbs Kwijiwabo is the one that heads slightly left.

The climbing is steep and technical for the first 30 feet, then moves over a small bulge and onto thin face climbing more typical of granite.

The climb is sustained throughout and loads of fun.
content.protection:
7 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.  Shares the first bolt with the two climbs to the right.

Can can hike around the left to the top of space wall to setup a top rope.

content.description: Stellar right-facing corner, stemming and jamming.  Of course, no one brings gear to a sport crag, but this one is worth it.
content.location: Dihedral to the left of Moon Shadow.

content.description:
This short, deep chimney is one of the cleanest (not clean, it IS a chimney) chimneys I've ever climbed. By cleanest I mean the relatively small amount of crud left on clothing, in the eyes, net blood lost, etc.

Climb up from wherever you choose in the chimney, But climbing is shorter and less exposed deep in the chimney.  There's also protection options in a crack system to the left. I topped out behind a moderate sized chockstone, though it was through a space that many probably will not fit.
content.protection:
1/2" - 2" cams, and a large sling for the chockstone at the top.

There are no anchors at the top, though with some mild inconveniences, you could place a top rope using cams or slings up top.
content.location:
The prominent deep chimney on the middle-right side of The Space Wall.

Walk off the top ( I didn't find a great way, and it took a while) either to the left or right.

content.description:
Climbs

Purple Toupee

to the first anchor chains, right before the 12b crux of PT.

New anchors added by the first ascensionist (thank you from all of us gumbys!)
content.protection: 8 bolts, fixed anchors (rap rings, but someone had donated a few carabiners)
content.location: Just left of the Made in Japan arete
Starts off a block approach via 4th class slab. To the right of Kwijiwabo, second bolt line from the left. Rap or lower off.
